captions.text:
So the other day, I got a message on Facebook
that said,

"Jon, I love the message of your videos
but not if it's coming from you.

There are choices you've made in your past
that render you not qualified to spread such

a message."
And for me, that was hard to hear

because the hypocritical Christian is something
I fear.

To be put in a category like that,
I could think of nothing worse.

So maybe there's something I should've said
first.

You see, I can't and won't and don't claim
to be perfect.

In fact, most times I'm not even good.
I'll take responsibility for the mistakes

I've made
and the hurts I've caused.

I got more than I probably should.
But would God use that against me,

making good coming from my life impossible?
Forgives me, but refuses to use me?

I don't believe in that Gospel.
I believe in the God of Moses.

Moses was an orphan and a murderer
with a stutter and a price on his head.

Yet God chose this killer to be a fulfiller,
performing miracles, leading his people,

and making rivers flow red.
I believe in the God of David.

David, the shepherd boy who turned into a
king,

a terrible father and an adulterer from the
start.

Yet even with wrongdoings and iniquity,
we remember him as the man after God's own

heart.
Mary Magdalene was a prostitute,

living a life without direction.
Matthew was a tax collector, the lowest of

the low,
yet they both walked and talked

and witnessed Christ's perfection.
Did God choose the Pharisees,

the self-righteous and pompous full of laws
and pretention?

Or did He choose cowardly Peter and persecuting
Paul

to spread the message of Christ's redemption?
All these heroes in the Bible, not a one of

them was likely.
Leaning not on themselves, they leaned on

God,
and you know what God is?

He is mighty.
So can God use me? A broken, steaming mess.

And can God use him, or her, or you?
I'm here to tell you right now that the answer

is yes.
God can and will use anybody

even if you only go to church on Christmas.
Does He only speak through the preacher?

No! God is in a different business,
because believing in the Lord

isn't living a perfect Walgreens life, always
doing right.

It's letting His light shine from within
and letting His Word be your tutor.

He'll take your broken past,
helping you step into a more hopeful future,

because it wasn't for perfection that Jesus
died on that cross.

It was for the unhealthy, so the sick could
serve the sick

and seek and save the lost.
'Cause in the end these words and these lights

and these cameras
and this video,

it's not about me.
It's about God.

And with God, it's never about who you were,
but about who you will be.

It's God's story for the world,
and we're just playing our parts.

So if you're out there feeling not qualified,
that's great,
because "not qualified" is where He starts.

comments.text: I would love to hear his testimony﻿
comments.author: live4him55

comments.text:
I am exactly like this. People don't believe I am credible and sometimes, 
they think I'm a hypocrite like the Pharisees and Scribes. They don't know 
that I feel way too broken inside. I also ask God if I was made for this 
because compared to everyone, I am just an unworthy piece. And I knew that 
there's something I missed. I missed the point why Christ died on the cross 
and it is to save those who are weak. Because He's strong in our weakness. 
And it's not about me or anyone else. It's about Him. And in the end, that 
is what will matter.

Thank you The Anima Series. I have been blessed through watching these 
videos. More power to you! God bless you!﻿

comments.author: Ann Ng

comments.text:
John, I don't think you will ever understand, truly how amazing your 
messages are. God works through you in such a powerful way. Just a video? 
no way, I have been having a very rough time walking with the Lord lately. 
All I would do is go to church and then go home and smoke a fatty. All I 
did was go through the motions. I was called to be a youth pastor but I 
lost sight and started having sex and getting faded. You are teaching me 
through God's word that He can use me. It is so hard to understand Him and 
understand what I am going through or why He can't make life perfect for 
me. I want to be used by God but 9 out of 10 times I do feel useless. I 
feel not qualified. Especially in church. This message helped me realize 
that I can. You have such an amazing affect on my night. Thank you so much.﻿

comments.text:
It hurts to read peoples comments, saying how terrible their life is. Im 
here to help people like you to get rid of this darkness. Dont worry, love. 
Everyone at some point in their life has difficult problems which they 
might think is impossible to solve. But with god, nothing is impossible. 
Just hang in there, friend. God will take care of the problem when he 
thinks the time is right. Pray to him constantly that he will fix things. 
Belive he will do it too. If you dont have faith, then it wont work as 
quickly. Hang in there, it will be over soon! :)

2 Corinthians 4:7 we now have this light shining in our hearts, but we 
ourselves are just fragile clay jars containing this great treasure. This 
makes it clear that our great power is from God and not from ourselves. 

I love this verse because the image is so profound. If we are a clay jar 
with a light inside how will people see the light. Well they see it in our 
brokenness, in our cracks and imperfections. God's power is shown in our 
weaknesses. Thank you for your obedience to God. I have enjoyed your 
transparency and your videos are inspiring! ﻿

comments.author: ZOE ~ ACTS 2:28

comments.text:
I can watch this video. But can I let this hope infuse everything I do 
today? Can I be used by Him? Used by the one who takes broken things and 
fulfills His purposes through them? Or will I hide and avoid every chance 
to show love. Will I be consumed by my insecurities and miss all the 
opportunities? Hide in a shell of shame...focus on every detail of myself 
that makes me unqualified. Is that what redeemed means? It's easy to say. 
It's only by His grace that we can step into His grace. 
#preachingthegospletomyself﻿

comments.text:
Powerful message. Sometimes I feel crazy believing it, and I certainly know 
most people think I am disqualified.  And yet I read the same Book you do, 
and I find myself coming to the same conclusions.  Moses the deliverer once 
delivered with murder.  David the blessed king once ruled with adulterous 
conspiracy.  Paul the great preacher once preached with murderous intent. 
 There's something about God that isn't controlled by our pasts, and this 
is nothing short of...wonderful. Thank-you for reminding me. ﻿

comments.text:
Hello, my name is Talia. I just wanted to say thank you so much for posting 
these videos. Honestly, I have really been struggling with a lot recently 
and seeing your videos have unplugged my spirit and reminded me of where my 
heart was at one point. I've allowed so much to influence me and to pull me 
down. I've allowed negative things to stay in my life when I really should 
have removed them as soon as I knew the was a problem. I lost the fire that 
I had in my heart for God and I've completely lost focus and have gone off 
in a very bad direction. Just within the past couple of days I've really 
been recognizing my choices and wanting to make a change. After watching a 
few off you're videos it has just reminded me of so much and it's almost as 
though a switch has been hit and I truly feel like I'm changing. I hope 
that God continues to use you and that you are able to reach ago many other 
people just add you reached me. 😊﻿
comments.author: Talia Hulslander

comments.text:
Aww, I know life can be tough sometimes, maybe even worse than you might 
think. But its just a test. Dont give in to those things. Dont let yourself 
get lost in your dark life. Instead, try and find the light. That light is 
God. God is the light that will guide you through darkness. When you feel 
like life has just got you down, remember to pray to god. Cling to him. He 
wony mind dealing with your problems, for with god, nothing is impossible. 
He also loves you. There is no way he would put you through that kind of 
torture if he knew you couldnt handle it. Its okay. Im inspired to help 
people who are in pain like you, so feel free to ask for advice

comments.text:
Yes. Amen!!!! I always tell people I am not perfect, and I don't try to 
play perfect either. I try to do good, and try to help. I always feel not 
qualified. I get tired of feeling that way. God knows my heart, and people 
will always judge a person on past mistakes, or things they can't change. 
We can only try to change the future. I will own my mistakes, and 
responsible for my mistakes. God is so good, and loves us. I can't sit in 
church every sunday, dress in fine clothes and play Christian and not admit 
no matter what, I am NOT PERFECT...Jesus loved us right where we were. HE 
WHO IS WITHOUT SIN CAST NOT THE FIRST STONE...ITS ABOUT GOD.﻿

comments.text:
I want to thank you for these inspirational videos. Everyone of them that I 
have seen has brought me a message that I needed to hear. I would also like 
to point out that in Mark 9:38-40 God rebukes his disciples for forbidding 
someone to do a good work in the name of God. If we are doing our best to 
follow Christ, and bring his teachings to the world, then He will bless us, 
even if others tell us that we are not fully on the right path. So, even 
though someone may think that you are not qualified because of your past, 
you have brought me closer to my Lord, and to a better understanding of 
myself. For that I want to thank you.﻿

comments.text:
I am so thankful to be hearing this message, because I have also felt the 
sting of the destructive bomb of unqualified from peers, myself, and those 
close to me. I guess hearing this helps me realize that others are out 
there feeling the same way. Others are out there who know what this is, so 
I should rejoice in that fact, because I am not alone. God is our 
strength, He makes us qualified, He is everything and without Him, we are 
unqualified, but I just want to encourage you that your honesty shows you 
are one of God's qualified!
Be in peace my brother in Christ,
Natasha Natewa﻿
comments.author: Natasha Natewa

comments.text:
God Loves Us SO Much that He gave His Only Begotten Son for us, in that 
while we were yet sinners, He reached out to us with His grace, Eph 2:8,9, 
no we are not deserving but He Loves us, just as we love our children, even 
though imperfect, God is Love. Thank you for pointing out how God uses us, 
though we are imperfect, sinners, by pointing to the faithful men of old, 
how quickly and easily we forget their sins and faults. How Encouraging 
this video is,,Many THanks For Posting This!! Be blessed!!﻿
